__README: This first JSON object is gonna be ignored by our app.
Below, I listed all content-types for which a template
already exists. We can make more templates easily, but
we'll need to know what we're trying to template first.
There may be a smarter way to make this even more
flexible, but I figured getting something out the door
that was pretty reasonably dynamic (and maintainable)

body.title: Getting Started
body.body: a job and starting your career is a process that can take time. It is recommended that you begin the search for your post-graduation job 9-10 months prior to finishing school. This will give you ample time to explore options, research companies, prepare your documents, apply for jobs, conduct interviews and negotiate offers.

body.title: What Can I Do With a Major In...?
1. Identify a Career Path
body.body: Your major does not lock you into one career option. Utilize the resources below explore the many options available to narrow down the specific types of jobs for which you want to apply.

body.title: 2. Research Companies
body.body: Learn more about the companies that interest you by researching their history, mission, products and services, awards or accolades, company culture and open positions. This research can help you assess whether or not a particular company will be a good fit with your career goals, values and skills.

body.title: 3. Prepare Job Search Documents
body.body: Learn more about the companies that interest you by researching their history, mission, products and services, awards or accolades, company culture and open positions. This research can help you assess whether or not a particular company will be a good fit with your career goals, values and skills.

title: Why is the Dragonslayer Blade iconic?
body: It is the very symbol of brute strength in a sword, for starters.

title: Zombini Wizard Breaks Down RBD Library Door, Career Center Uncomfortable
body: well there was a zombie and then he got out of his restraints so they called him zombini and then he also knew magic and now he got in the library and maybe we're next because we're right next door

body.body: is the ultimate trial for securing your job and is your chance to showcase the skills and abilities you described in your job search documents. Additionally, the interview is both you and the employer’s opportunity to ensure that you are a good fit for the company and its unique culture.

body.title: Interview Tips
body.body: Before you begin practicing your interview skills, review these interview preparation strategies and sample questions.

body.title: InterviewStream
body.body: Digitally record multiple practice interviews using a web-cam equipped computer using InterviewStream. You can choose from a list of predefined interview questions sets or select your own set of interview questions. InterviewStream is a great starting point for those new to interviewing.
body.note: You must use an Auburn email address.

body.title: Mock Interviews
body.body: When you have an interview scheduled and have practiced with InterviewStream, schedule a mock interview with a career counselor/advisor to serve as a dress rehearsal. You will come to the interview dressed professionally with a resume. Call the Career Center at 334-844-4744 to schedule an appointment.

body.title: Thank You
body.body: Following an interview, always send a thank you note to the person or persons with whom you interviewed. Handwritten notes are preferred; however, if you have poor handwriting skills or know that the employer will be making a final decision very quickly, you may elect to send an e-mail thank you message. Thank the interviewer for his or her time and reiterate your specific interest in the position and company. A general rule of thumb is to send a thank you note to any company employee who spent more than 10-15 minutes with you. This may include an individual you gave you a tour of the facility or took you to lunch during the course of your interview. Remember to ask for business cards while on your interview so that you can have the individuals’ names and mailing information.
